history.content:
You can find most all the details regarding Reader positions and the application through this link: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/ta_applications.shtml#reader

The application can be found here: https://willow.coe.berkeley.edu/PHP/gsiapp/menu.php?dept=eecs&type=r and is pretty self explanatory.  You will need to upload your latest transcript and indicate which courses you are most interested in.

Each semester, most all Readers are hired by the third week of classes.  The application deadline is tentatively scheduled for mid-August, though hasn't been set because summer hiring is still being finalized.  The number of hours is based on the enrollment of the class, but typically people will work between 5 and 10 hours a week.  Think about what your schedule will allow.

For the 61 series, the readers are mostly chosen by the instructors, so, in addition to filing an application, you may want to send a brief e-mail to the instructor saying

something like "Hi, I'm interested in reading for your course, and I submitted an application.  I took it in Fall x and got an A+."  One thing to know is that though the

grade requirement in the course you're reading is technically a B, most of the instructors will want a B+ and perhaps something higher.

Being a reader means that you do grading for the course.  You will be supervised by the GSIs, and you will probably mainly do the homeworks, though now that we've

shifted to online grading, there may be work for you to do assisting with the exams.

We are, by the way, still taking applications for summer readers, though I know that this particular question was not about that.  If any readers are interested,

please submit an application.  The summer application is at the same location.

You can find most all the details regarding Reader positions and the application through this link: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/ta_applications.shtml#reader

The application can be found here: https://willow.coe.berkeley.edu/PHP/gsiapp/menu.php?dept=eecs&type=r and is pretty self explanatory.  You will need to upload your latest transcript and indicate which courses you are most interested in.

children.subject: Read more carefully: "Each semester, most all Readers are hired by the third week of classes."
When is the expected time to hear back from the reader applications?

history.content:
Hi. 
I'm interested in becoming a reader (most interested in 61b) for the fall and was hoping someone could walk me through the process. What do I need to do to apply, what responsibilities and time does that entail, what qualifications do I need, where do I find the app, when is the app due, tips for the application, etc. 
Thanks in advance.
history.subject: Reader application fall 2015
